Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water and show how it looks healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not have water and show how it looks wilted or not growing well.
The student can illustrate the effects of water on plants by showing side-by-side comparisons of plants with and without water.
The student can show through drawing that plants need sunlight in addition to water to live and grow.
The student can identify patterns in their drawings that demonstrate the differences in plant health based on water availability.
